race.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a competition in which people or animals compete to run, drive etc fastest and finish first
race.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: He will be the youngest runner in the race.
Over 80 cars will take part in the race.
the annual boat race between Oxford and Cambridge Universities
race.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: one of the main groups that humans can be divided into according to the colour of their skin and other physical features
race.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The school welcomes children of all races.
The law forbids discrimination on the grounds of race or religion.
race.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a group of people who are similar in some way
race.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The 1960s produced a new race of young novelists.
Are schools breeding  (=producing) a race of children incapable of making decisions for themselves?
race.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a situation in which one group of people tries to obtain or achieve something before another group does
race.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The race is on to develop more environmentally friendly forms of energy.
More and more drug companies are joining the race to beat cancer.
race.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a situation in which you have to do something very quickly because you have very little time available
race.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: The pilot then began a desperate race against time to land the plane before it ran out of fuel.
It is now a race to find the killer.
race.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a situation in which people are competing with each other to win a prize or obtain a position of power
race.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: Mr Bird has now officially joined the race for the White House.
He is no longer in the race for academic awards.
the race to host the next Olympic Games
race.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: a competition in which people or animals compete to run, drive etc fastest and finish first
race.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: compete in a race
He is competing in his first race this year.
Runners from all over the world will take part in the race.
have a race
Let’s have a race!
hold a race
The race will be held on February 25th.
win/lose a race
He did not win another race that season.
come first/last etc in a race
She came third in the race.
lead the race
He led the race from start to finish.
finish the race
Congratulations to Matthew, who finished the race in three hours 17 minutes.
run a race
I thought I ran a good race.
enter somebody/something in a race
The horse is entered in a race at Worcester the day after tomorrow.
ADJECTIVES/NOUN + race
tough/hard
He said he expected the race to be tough.
the big race
There are only three days to go until the big race.
a 3000 metres/10 km etc race
He finished first in the 100 metres race.
a horse/boat/bike etc race
It’s legal to gamble on horse races.
a road race
She regularly competes in 10 kilometre road races.
race.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 5: a situation in which people are competing with each other to win a prize or obtain a position of power
race.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: enter/join the race
There was speculation that another candidate might enter the race.
drop out of/withdraw from the race
He dropped out of the presidential race three weeks ago.
stay in the race
Forbes has the money to stay in the mayoral race as long as he likes.
win a race
It looks as though he will win the race to be the Democratic presidential candidate.
ADJECTIVES/NOUN + race
close/tight
Most people were predicting a close race.
a three-horse/three-way race
In a three-way race, Clinton received 47 percent, Dole 35 percent, Perot 10 percent.
a two-horse/two-way race
It soon became clear that it would be a two-horse race.
a one-horse race
This is turning into a one-horse race.
a presidential/Senate/mayoral race
He put $12 million of his own money into a Senate race.
be still in the race
Swindon Town is still in the race, despite losing to Manchester City on Saturday.
race.translation[0].note_box[2].sections: one of the main groups of people in the world, who have the same colour of skin and other physical features
Everybody should be treated equally regardless of their race or sex.
race relations (=the relationship between people of different races)
a country and its people, or a group of people with the same history and language
Japan has become one of the richest nations in the world.
Our dream is for a united Arab nation.
the people who belong to a particular country, race, or area. The plural of this meaning of people is peoples
the native peoples of the islands
a group of people in a country who are the same race, with the same traditional way of life and the same leader
a tribe in Papua New Guinea
a group of people of the same race, nation, or tribe
Within Namibia there are more than a dozen different ethnic groups.
the needs of minority ethnic groups
race.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to compete against someone or something in a race
race.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: She’ll be racing against some of the world’s top athletes.
Stevens will not be racing in the final due to a knee injury.
I’ll race you to the end of the road.
race.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to use an animal or a vehicle to compete in a race
race.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: He will be racing a Ferrari in this year’s Formula One championships.
race.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to move very quickly or take someone or something to a place very quickly
race.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: He raced into the village on his bike.
I had to race home for my bag.
race.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to try to do something very quickly because you want to be the first to do it, or because there is very little time available
race.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: The astronauts are racing against time to repair the spaceship.
Investors are racing to buy shares in the new hi-tech companies.
race.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: if your heart or mind races, it works harder and faster than usual, for example because you are afraid or excited
race.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: My heart was racing and my knees shook uncontrollably.
My mind was racing, trying to think where I had seen him before.
race.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: if an engine races, it runs too fast
